Message: Impossible Physics. Inert substrate cannot leech ammonia. You must select Liquid Ammonia.
Animal Cruelty. With no soil or liquid ammonia, you are forcing fish to generate the cycle waste in a sterile tank.
Missing Fuel. You cannot run a fishless cycle without an ammonia source (Liquid or Soil).
Toxicity Spike. Aquasoil already releases ammonia. Dosing liquid ammonia on top will create toxic levels.
Hardware Failure. You selected High Light Demand plants but only have Basic Lights. They will die regardless of the cycle.
Method Failure. Silent Cycle relies on soil nutrients to feed roots. Inert sand cannot support this.
Biology Failure. Silent Cycle requires High Plant Density to consume ammonia immediately. Low density results in algae.
Biology Failure. Slow plants (Buce/Anubias) cannot metabolize ammonia fast enough for a Silent Cycle. You need Fast Stems.
Metabolic Failure. High Demand plants without CO2 cannot grow fast enough to absorb the ammonia spike.
Energy Bottleneck. Even for low-demand weeds, basic lights might be too weak to drive the *rapid* growth needed for a Silent Cycle.
Algae Risk. High Light + Low Demand Plants + No CO2 = Algae Farm. You must DIM lights to <30%.
Wasted Potential. Fast plants need nutrients immediately. A Dark Start removes the initial soil ammonia spike they crave.
Pointless. Inert substrate with no ammonia source is just a bucket of water. Darkness achieves nothing.
Starvation. High Demand Fast plants need Soil or Water Column dosing + High Light. On Inert sand, they will die.
Nutrient Gap. Low Demand Fast plants (weeds) survive light levels, but starve on Inert sand. You MUST add Liquid Fertilizer daily.
Optimal Match. High energy, high demand, and high biomass will consume the soil ammonia instantly.
Optimal Match. High light + Slow plants usually equals algae. Dark start avoids this risk perfectly.
Optimal Low Tech. Soil provides nutrients, low light prevents algae, and water changes manage the cycle.
Optimal Control. Dosing liquid ammonia allows precise control for delicate/slow plants. Safe and reliable.
Biologically Valid. Dosing ammonia in the dark cycles the bacteria safely without any algae risk.
Configuration Mismatch. You selected Silent Cycle but lack the specific Hardware/Plant combination to make it safe.
Safe Fallback. Dark Start is rarely 'wrong', just sometimes slow.
Standard Method. If no other warnings triggered, Fishless Cycling is the standard recommendation.
Suboptimal. Fishless methods are objectively safer. Proceed only if you are experienced.
